title: Need recommendations for pretty numerals
content:
Hi guys, I’m working on a historic timeline kind of thing, and I need some recommendations for fonts with pretty numerals. The rest of the book has kinda a old / vintage / grungey / handmade feel, but I don’t need these numerals to have this feel. I might or might not distress them.

I kinda like the exploding numerals on the [Franck Muller watches](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014000206/http:/www.blowers-jewellers.co.uk/watches_franck_muller.htm) too.

Hope you can help. Thanks!

 [‹ (x) Camco Inc. logo - Friz Quadrata {Nicolai}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014000206/http:/typophile.com/node/15843 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) PostGIS logo - Advertiser's Gothic {Mark S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014000206/http:/typophile.com/node/15836 "Go to next forum topic")
author: karenhuang

comments.content: [These](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014000206/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_crash.html) are neat — they have two positions (slightly up, and slightly down) per numeral for both the serif and the sans variations, and they’re free to boot.

I may 2nd Yves on the ’Crash Numbering Kit’ lettering and I also like the numerals featured in ’Dalliance’..

_Edit-A-Bit.:_ And, You may like the pretty numerals of ’ [Fleurie](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014000206/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/fleurie/)’, by Gert Wiescher..

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014000206/http:/www.formlos.net/)

Yeah, I love the Crash Numbering set too! Looooove them to bits. Will be using it for a website soon, hopefully. But for a book, I was hoping for something semi-serious. I though Caslon would have nice numerals, but the zeros are funnily geometric...

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/walbaum-fraktur/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014000206/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/walbaum-fraktur/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/walbaum-fraktur/")

The numerals aren’t what I’d expect from a fraktur  
Tim

You’re right. A most interesting set of numerals, considering the font! And they’re pretty too!

Well, I hope to get more suggestions anyway.

Most attractive:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/15443](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014000206/http:/typophile.com/node/15443 "http://typophile.com/node/15443") \_  
Bottom of first post.

Most repulsive:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/schadow/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014000206/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/schadow/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/schadow/") \_  
Make me wanna puke every single time I see them.

hhp

Check out Sumner Stone’s rendition of Bodoni’s Display figures on [this page.](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014000206/http:/www.stonetypefoundry.com/html_pages/BodoniOverview.html)

Unfortunately, I don’t see a good showing of them on the site, but I have them, and they’re gorgeous.

Karen, I just had an idea. A bit hard to work, but: since it’s a timeline, what if you used a bevy of numeral styles, each typical of the period being marked?

hhp

I have always liked the numerals in ITC Tiffany Demi

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/tiffany/demi/charmap.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014000206/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/tiffany/demi/charmap.html "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/tiffany/demi/charmap.html")
